35 namespace Mutation {

37 
39 template <typename T>
40 class Interpolator
41 {
42 public:
43 
45  static std::string typeName() { return "Interpolator"; }
46 
47  // Arguments for self registering constructor
48  struct ARGS {
49  ARGS(
50  const T* const arg1, const T* const arg2, int arg3) :
51  x(arg1), y(arg2), n(arg3) {}
52  const T* const x;
53  const T* const y;
54  int n;
55  };
56 
58  Interpolator(ARGS args) { }
59 
61  virtual ~Interpolator() { }
62 
64  virtual T operator() (const T& x) = 0;
65 }; // Interpolator
66 
67 //==============================================================================
68 
74 template <typename T>
75 class ChebyshevInterpolator : public Interpolator<T>
76 {
77 public:
78 
79  typedef Eigen::Array<T,-1,1> ArrayType;
80 
82  ChebyshevInterpolator(typename Interpolator<T>::ARGS args) :
83  Interpolator<T>(args),
84  m_points(args.n-1), m_eta_map(args.n-1), m_y_map(args.n-1),
85  m_phi(args.n-1)
86  {
87  const T* const x = args.x;
88  const T* const y = args.y;
89  const int n = args.n;
90  const double PI = std::acos(-1.0);
91 
92  // Minimum, median, and maximum
93  m_min = x[0];
94  m_mid = x[(n-1)/2];
95  m_max = x[n-1];
96 
97  // Compute the Chebyshev-Gauss-Lobatto grid
98  ArrayType cgl(m_points);
99  for (int i = 0; i < m_points; ++i)
100  cgl(i) = std::cos(PI*i/(m_points-1.0));
101 
102  // Compute the new
103  T mid = m_mid - m_min;
104  T max = m_max - m_min;
105  T a = mid*max/(max - 2.0*mid);
106  T b = 1.0 + 2.0*a/max;
107  ArrayType x_map = a*(1.0 + cgl)/(b - cgl) + m_min;
108 
109  m_eta_map = (m_mid - x_map)/(2.0*m_mid*x_map/m_max - x_map - m_mid);
110 
111  // Interpolating points onto new map
112  int k;
113  for (int i = 0; i < m_points; ++i) {
114  k = 1;
115  while (x[k] < x_map(i) && k < m_points) ++k;
116  m_y_map(i) = (x_map(i) - x[k-1])*(y[k] - y[k-1])/(x[k] - x[k-1]) + y[k-1];
117  }
118  }
119 
120  int nPoints() const { return m_points; }
121 
123  T operator() (const T& x)
124  {
125  T eta = (m_mid - x)/(2.0*m_mid*x/m_max - x - m_mid);
126 
127  for (int j = 0; j < m_points; ++j) {
128  m_phi(j) = 1.0;
129  for (int k = 0; k < j; ++k)
130  m_phi(j) *= (eta - m_eta_map(k))/(m_eta_map(j) - m_eta_map(k));
131  for (int k = j+1; k < m_points; ++k)
132  m_phi(j) *= (eta - m_eta_map(k))/(m_eta_map(j) - m_eta_map(k));
133  }
134 
135  return (m_phi*m_y_map).sum();
136  }
137 
138 private:
139 
140  int m_points;
141 
142  ArrayType m_eta_map;
143  ArrayType m_y_map;
144  ArrayType m_phi;
145 
146  T m_min;
147  T m_mid;
148  T m_max;
149 }; // ChebyshevInterpolator
150 
151 //==============================================================================
152 
154 template <typename T>
155 class LinearInterpolator : public Interpolator<T>
156 {
157 public:
158 
159  typedef Eigen::Array<T,-1,1> ArrayType;
160 
161  LinearInterpolator(typename Interpolator<T>::ARGS args) :
162  Interpolator<T>(args),
163  m_x(Eigen::Map<const ArrayType>(args.x, args.n)),
164  m_y(Eigen::Map<const ArrayType>(args.y, args.n))
165  { }
166 
167  int nPoints() const { return m_x.size(); }
168 
170  T operator() (const T& x)
171  {
172  int i = 1;
173  while (m_x[i] < x && i < m_x.size()-1) i++;
174 
175  // Interpolate
176  return (m_y[i]-m_y[i-1])*(x-m_x[i])/(m_x[i]-m_x[i-1])+m_y[i];
177  }
178 
179 private:
180 
181  const ArrayType m_x;
182  const ArrayType m_y;
183 
184 }; // LinearInterpolator
185 
186 //==============================================================================
187 
189 template <typename T>
190 class MCHInterpolator : public Interpolator<T>
191 {
192 public:
194  MCHInterpolator(typename Interpolator<T>::ARGS args) :
195  Interpolator<T>(args),
196  m_points(args.n), m_x(args.n), m_y(args.n), m_c1(args.n), m_c2(args.n),
197  m_c3(args.n)
198  {
199  const T* const x = args.x;
200  const T* const y = args.y;
201  const int n = args.n;
202 
203  // Store the x and y values
204  for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
205  m_x[i] = x[i];
206  m_y[i] = y[i];
207  }
208 
209  // Get consecutive differences and slopes
210  std::vector<T> dx(n);
211  std::vector<T> dy(n);
212  std::vector<T> m(n);
213  for (int i = 0; i < n-1; ++i) {
214  dx[i] = x[i+1] - x[i];
215  dy[i] = y[i+1] - y[i];
216  m[i] = dy[i] / dx[i];
217  }
218 
219  // Get degree-1 coefficients
220  m_c1[0] = m[0];
221  for (int i = 1; i < n-1; ++i) {
222  if (m[i-1]*m[i] <= 0)
223  m_c1[i] = T(0);
224  else {
225  T c = dx[i-1] + dx[i];
226  m_c1[i] = 3*c/((c + dx[i])/m[i-1] + (c + dx[i-1])/m[i]);
227  }
228  }
229  m_c1[n-1] = m[n-1];
230 
231  // Get degree-2 and degree-3 coefficients
232  for (int i = 0; i < n-1; ++i) {
233  T c = m_c1[i] + m_c1[i+1] - 2*m[i];
234  m_c2[i] = (m[i] - m_c1[i] - c)/dx[i];
235  m_c3[i] = c/(dx[i]*dx[i]);
236  }
237  }
238 
239  int nPoints() const { return m_points; }
240 
242  T operator() (const T& x)
243  {
244  if (x >= m_x[m_points-1])
245  return m_y[m_points-1];
246 
247  if (x <= m_x[0])
248  return m_y[0];
249 
250  int i = static_cast<int>(
251  std::lower_bound(&m_x[0], &m_x[0] + m_points - 1, x) - &m_x[0]) - 1;
252 
253  T d = x - m_x[i];
254  return m_y[i] + ((m_c3[i]*d + m_c2[i])*d + m_c1[i])*d;
255  }
256 
257 private:
258 
259  int sgn(T val) {
260  return (T(0) < val) - (val < T(0));
261  }
262 
263 private:
264 
265  int m_points;
266  std::vector<T> m_x;
267  std::vector<T> m_y;
268  std::vector<T> m_c1;
269  std::vector<T> m_c2;
270  std::vector<T> m_c3;
271 }; // MCHInterpolator
272 
273 //==============================================================================
274 
275  } // Numerics
276 } // Mutation
